targets.formattedQuery: SELECT $timeSeries as t, count() FROM $table WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY t ORDER BY t
targets.query:
SELECT
    $timeSeries as t,
    count()
FROM $table
WHERE $timeFilter
GROUP BY t
ORDER BY t
targets.rawQuery: SELECT     (intDiv(1537142400, 900) * 900) * 1000 as t,     count() FROM third_test_query.ip_log_distributed_05_replica WHERE 1536969600 >= toDate(1537272245) AND 1537142400 >= 1537272245 GROUP BY t ORDER BY t

targets.expr: ( node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{instance=~"10.0.40.*"} - node_memory_MemFree_bytes - node_memory_Buffers_bytes - node_memory_Cached_bytes - node_memory_SwapCached_bytes - node_memory_Slab_bytes - node_memory_PageTables_bytes - node_memory_VmallocUsed_bytes )

panels.description: Number of queries to be interpreted and potentially executed. Does not include queries that failed to parse or were rejected due to AST size limits, quota limits or limits on the number of simultaneously running queries. May include internal queries initiated by ClickHouse itself. Does not count subqueries.
panels.title: Query Total

panels.description: Total amount of memory (bytes) allocated in currently executing queries. Note that some memory allocations may not be accounted.
panels.title: Query Memory Use

panels.description: Same as Query, but only for SELECT queries.
panels.title: Select Query

panels.description: Number of bytes (uncompressed; for columns as they stored in memory) INSERTed to all tables.
panels.title: Inserted Rows

panels.description: Same as Query, but only for INSERT queries.
panels.title: Insert Query

panels.description: Number of bytes (uncompressed; for columns as they stored in memory) INSERTed to all tables.
panels.title: Inserted Bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes (uncompressed; for columns as they stored in memory) INSERTed to all tables.
panels.title: Delayed Inserts Milliseconds

panels.description: Number of rows INSERTed to all tables.
panels.title: Delayed Inserts

panels.description: Number of reads from a file that were slow. This indicate system overload. Thresholds are controlled by read_backoff_* settings.
panels.title: Slow Read

targets.formattedQuery: SELECT $timeSeries as t, count() FROM $table WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY t ORDER BY t
targets.query:
SELECT 
    query_start_time AS start, 
    multiIf(type = 1, 'start', type = 2, 'success',type = 3, 'errorBeforeStart',type = 4, 'errorProcessing', 'other') AS status, 
    query_duration_ms / 1000 AS useSeconds, 
    read_rows AS readRows, 
    result_rows AS resultRows, 
    memory_usage / (1024 * 1024) AS memoryUsageMB, 
    query, 
    query_id, 
    substring(IPv6NumToString(address),8,15) AS queryFromHost
FROM k19_distribute.query_log 
WHERE ((start >= $from) AND (start <= $to)) AND (query_duration_ms >=40000)
ORDER BY 
    useSeconds DESC, 
    memoryUsageMB DESC, 
    readRows DESC
LIMIT 20

targets.formattedQuery: SELECT $timeSeries as t, count() FROM $table WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY t ORDER BY t
targets.query:
SELECT query_start_time AS start, 
    multiIf(type = 1, 'start', type = 2, 'success',type = 3, 'ExceptionBeforeStart',type = 4, 'ExceptionWhileProcessing', 'other') AS status, 
    query_duration_ms / 1000 AS useSeconds, 
    written_rows AS writeRows, 
    written_bytes/1024/1024 AS writtenMB,
    memory_usage / (1024 * 1024) AS memoryUsageMB, 
    query, 
    query_id, 
    substring(IPv6NumToString(address),8,15) AS queryFromHost
FROM k19_distribute.query_log 
WHERE ((start >= $from) AND (start <= $to)) AND (query_duration_ms >=30000)
AND writeRows>10000
ORDER BY useSeconds DESC,writeRows DESC ,query_start_time DESC
LIMIT 20
